title: 110_s1699
content: The "Strengthening Kids' Interest in Learning and Libraries Act" or the "SKILLs Act" amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 by updating authorization of appropriations and state plans. SEC. 102 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to ensure each school has a qualified library media specialist. SEC. 103 addresses local educational agency plans. SEC. 103 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include at least 1 highly qualified school library media specialist in each school. SEC. 104 and SEC. 105 also mention the inclusion of school library media specialists in schoolwide programs and targeted assistance schools. SEC. 106 outlines qualifications for teachers, paraprofessionals, and school library media specialists. In an amendment to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act, each local educational agency must ensure that each school employs at least 1 highly qualified school library media specialist. Each State educational agency must establish a goal of having at least 1 highly qualified school library media specialist in each public school receiving funds under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act by the beginning of the 2010-2011 school year. Additionally, the Act includes a conforming amendment to include school library and media specialists in the requirements for highly qualified staff. The Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to change subsection (1) to subsection (m). SEC. 107. IMPROVING LITERACY THROUGH SCHOOL LIBRARIES. Section 1251 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to change qualifications for educators, adjust grant distribution criteria, and ensure funding balance among different school levels. Section 1251 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to change educator qualifications, adjust grant distribution criteria, and ensure funding balance among different school levels. Amendments include the need for student literacy improvement at all grade levels, replacing "well-trained, professionally certified" with "highly qualified," conducting a needs assessment for grade spans served, and providing reading materials for elementary, middle, and high schools. The amendment to Section 1251 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 focuses on providing appropriate books and materials for students of all grade levels and special learning needs. It also emphasizes the importance of engaging readers at all reading levels and enhancing professional development in information literacy instruction across content areas. Title II of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include training and recruiting funds for high-quality teachers, school library media specialists, and principals. The purpose of this amendment is to enhance professional development in information literacy instruction across content areas. The purpose of amending Section 2101(1) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is to increase student academic achievement by improving teacher, school library media specialist, and principal quality, and by increasing the number of highly qualified educators in schools. SEC. 203 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include school library media specialists in certain paragraphs. SEC. 204 addresses state use of funds. SEC. 204 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to include highly qualified school library media specialists in state use of funds. SEC. 205 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act to focus on recruiting and retaining highly qualified school library media specialists and providing professional development for them, especially in skills related to information literacy. Section 9101(23) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to define the qualifications for a school library media specialist in an elementary or secondary school. The qualifications for a school library media specialist in an elementary or secondary school include State certification, meeting requirements set by the State's public charter school law, and not having certification requirements waived on an emergency basis. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include qualifications for teachers, paraprofessionals, and school library media specialists. This amendment also addresses preparing, training, and recruiting high-quality educators and establishes a fund for teacher, school library media specialist, and principal training and recruiting.
